thread.title: SULLY STOPS BY: Opening day at the new President Avenue McDonald's
thread.title_full: SULLY STOPS BY: Opening day at the new President Avenue McDonald's

author: Greg Sullivan
title: SULLY STOPS BY: Opening day at the new President Avenue McDonald's
text: Posted Oct. 17, 2015 at 9:21 AM Updated Oct 17, 2015 at 11:53 AM Tweets by @GregSullivanHN FALL RIVER -- More than once over the previous three months, this writer, after an assignment at Durfee High School or Bishop Connolly High School, turned into the shopping plaza parking lot at President Avenue and Elsbree Street with the intention of ordering a couple of hamburgers and fries at McDonald's. Of course, McDonald's was gone. Open-hand slap to the forehead and back to the office went I. But those frustrating days are gone. The new fancy-Dan McDonald's opened on Friday, and it seemed like a nifty spot for the second episode of Sully Stops By. We did a hands-on check of the new facility -- including the play area -- met owner Paul Farren, a former longtime offensive lineman with the Cleveland Browns, and put the girl at the drive-thru to the test. While we should care more about who will be our next mayor, let's be honest, having our beloved McDonald's back in what really matters to us. Please watch the video, which was recorded on Friday, Oct. 16, 2015. Email Greg Sullivan at gsullivan@heraldnews.com. Follow him @GregSullivanHN.
